titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Russia. Posol'stvo (U.S.) Records, 1897-1947.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael Jakobson.; machine-readable finding aid created by James Ryan.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-09-06T16:41-0700

physdesc.extent: 383 manuscript boxes, 85 oversize boxes, 6 card file boxes, 6 envelopes

did.abstract: Correspondence, telegrams, memoranda, reports, agreements, minutes, histories, financial records, lists, and printed matter, relating to Russia's role in World War I, the Russian Revolution and Civil War, activities of the Russian Red Cross, Russian emigres in foreign countries, and operations of the embassy office. Includes files of the Russian Military, Naval, and Financial Attaches in the United States; the Russian State Control Office and the Russian Supply Committee Office in the United States; and the Consulate General in Montreal, Canada. Entire collection also on microfilm (484 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Microfilm use only.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Russia. Posol'stvo (U.S.) Records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1933.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, telegrams, memoranda, reports, agreements, minutes, histories, financial records, lists, and printed matter, relating to Russia's role in World War I, the Russian Revolution and Civil War, activities of the Russian Red Cross, Russian emigres in foreign countries, and operations of the embassy office. Includes files of the Russian Military, Naval, and Financial Attaches in the United States; the Russian State Control Office and the Russian Supply Committee Office in the United States; and the Consulate General in Montreal, Canada. Entire collection also on microfilm (484 reels).

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Russian Imperial and Provisional Government embassy in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, communiques, correspondence, financial records, memoranda, minutes, notes, printed matter, reports, speeches, arranged alphabetically by subject.
